title: Temporal Embeddings: Scalable Self-Supervised Temporal Representation Learning from Spatiotemporal Data for Multimodal Computer Vision. (arXiv:2401.08581v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: There exists a correlation between geospatial activity temporal patterns and type of land use. A novel self-supervised approach is proposed to stratify landscape based on mobility activity time series. First, the time series signal is transformed to the frequency domain and then compressed into task-agnostic temporal embeddings by a contractive autoencoder, which preserves cyclic temporal patterns observed in time series. The pixel-wise embeddings are converted to image-like channels that can be used for task-based, multimodal modeling of downstream geospatial tasks using deep semantic segmentation. Experiments show that temporal embeddings are semantically meaningful representations of time series data and are effective across different tasks such as classifying residential area and commercial areas. translated_title: 时间嵌入：从时空数据中进行可扩展的自监督时序表示学习，用于多模态计算机视觉
translated_abstract: 地理活动的时间模式与土地利用类型之间存在相关性。提出了一种新颖的自监督方法，通过压缩自编码器将时间序列信号转换到频域，并将其转换为图像通道，用于下游地理空间任务的深度语义分割。实验表明，时间嵌入是时间序列数据的语义有意义的表示，对于分类住宅区和商业区等不同任务具有有效性。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种自监督的时间嵌入方法，可以将地理活动的时间模式与土地利用类型相对应。通过将时间序列信号转换到频域并压缩为语义分割所需的图像通道，时间嵌入可以有效地表示时间序列数据，并用于多个地理空间任务。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a self-supervised temporal embedding method that correlates geospatial activity temporal patterns with type of land use. By transforming time series signals to the frequency domain and compressing them into image-like channels for semantic segmentation, temporal embeddings effectively represent time series data for various geospatial tasks.
